get.description: This API fetches a single product from your helpdesk.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Key that fetches secondary information related to the product. Values allowed are: @departments@ and @owner@. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas.

schema.description: Key that fetches secondary information related to the product. Values allowed are: @departments@ and @owner@. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas.

patch.description: This API updates details of a product in your help desk portal.

get.description: This API displays the total number of products in your helpdesk.

parameters.name: departmentIds
parameters.description: This key will soon be deprecated from both API requests and responses. Please replace it with the departmentId key in your code.

schema.description: This key will soon be deprecated from both API requests and responses. Please replace it with the departmentId key in your code.

x-custom-parameters-attributes: This key will soon be deprecated from both API requests and responses. Please replace it with the departmentId key in your code.

get.description: This API lists a specific number of products from your help desk portal, based on the limit defined. (Note: The departmentIds key will soon be deprecated and not included in API responses.)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Secondary information related to the contact.Value supported is @owner@.

schema.description: Secondary information related to the contact.Value supported is @owner@.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by a specific attribute : @productName@, @productCode@, @unitPrice@, @createdTime@ or @modifiedTime@. The default sorting order is ascending. A @-@ prefix denotes descending order of sorting.

schema.description: Sort by a specific attribute : @productName@, @productCode@, @unitPrice@, @createdTime@ or @modifiedTime@. The default sorting order is ascending. A @-@ prefix denotes descending order of sorting.

post.description: This API adds a product to your helpdesk.
This API moves products to the Recycle Bin of your help desk portal.
This API associates accounts with a product. Only a maximum of 10 accounts can be associated with a product through a single API request.
This API associates contacts with a product. Only a maximum of 10 contacts can be associated with a product through a single API request.
This API updates a single field value of multiple products simultaneously.

get.description: This API searches for duplicate records of a product.
This API lists products associated for a specific account.

schema.description: ID of the account associated with the product !@exact match@!

get.description: This API lists products associated for a specific contact.

schema.description: ID of the contact associated with the product !@exact match@!

include.descrption: Key that fetches secondary information related to the product. Values allowed are: @departments@ and @owner@. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas.
Key that fetches secondary information related to the product. Values allowed are: @departments@ and @owner@. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas.

x-custom-parameters-attributes.descrption: User who added the product to the help desk portal
Time of adding the product to the help desk portal
User who modified the details of the product

accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: ID of the account associated with the product !@exact match@!

schema.description: ID of the account associated with the product !@exact match@!

contactId.name: contactId
contactId.description: ID of the contact associated with the product !@exact match@!

schema.description: ID of the contact associated with the product !@exact match@!

departmentId.name: departmentId
departmentId.description: ID of the department from which the products count must be computed. If you want to count of the products configured in all accessible departments, pass the value 0.

schema.description: ID of the department from which the products count must be computed. If you want to count of the products configured in all accessible departments, pass the value 0.

from.name: from
from.description: Index number, starting from which the products must be fetched

schema.description: Index number, starting from which the products must be fetched

ownerId.name: ownerId
ownerId.description: Displays the number of products of only a particular owner

schema.description: Displays the number of products of only a particular owner

productName.name: productName
productName.description: Name of the product, used as the keyword for the search

schema.description: Name of the product, used as the keyword for the search
